posts.name: Jackson Elia
posts.cooked:
Hi!

Is there a way to get the time stamp for when the limelight sees an April tag and calculates its position? I checked the docs and couldn’t find a network table entry for it.

Thanks!

posts.name: Kevin Hjelstrom
posts.cooked:
This wiki page might have what you are looking for. Take a look at the “tl” and “TS” entries.

https://docs.limelightvision.io/en/latest/json_dump.html

posts.name: Jackson Elia
posts.cooked: Sorry, I misunderstood how the TS entry works. Is there a way that I can get the timestamp in real time? Can you access the json dump in real time, if so how?

posts.name: Jack R
posts.cooked: Source?  I only see it in the JSON dump according to the docs.

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked: The JSON dump is available in networktables according to the docs.

posts.name: Sean B
posts.cooked: Limelight publishes latency directly to networktables as “tl” - see Complete NetworkTables API — Limelight 1.0 documentation

posts.name: Jackson Elia
posts.cooked:
